items.label: cor-quantitative-lsi-final
items.title: Quantitative LSI Constant
items.content:
1814: :label: cor-quantitative-lsi-final
1815: 
1816: For the N-particle Euclidean Gas with parameters:
1817: - Friction $\gamma > 0$
1818: - Confining potential convexity $\kappa_{\text{conf}} > 0$
1819: - Cloning Wasserstein contraction $\kappa_W > 0$ (from Keystone Principle)
1820: - Kinetic time step $\tau > 0$
1821: - Maximum velocity $v_{\max}$
1822: - Domain radius $r_{\text{valid}}$
1823: 
1824: the system satisfies an LSI provided:
1825: 
1826: **Seesaw condition:**
1827: 
1828: $$
1829: \kappa_W > \frac{\beta}{1 + \beta} \quad \text{where} \quad \beta = O\left(\frac{\tau v_{\max}^2}{r_{\text{valid}}^2}\right)
1830: $$
1831: 
1832: The LSI constant is:
1833: 
1834: $$
1835: C_{\text{LSI}} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_W}\right)
1836: $$
1837: 
1838: **Practical interpretation:**
1839: - Small time steps $\tau$ reduce $\beta$, making the seesaw condition easier to satisfy

items.label: cor-adaptive-lsi
items.title: LSI for the ρ-Localized Geometric Gas
items.content:
1997: :label: cor-adaptive-lsi
1998: 
1999: For the geometric gas with localization scale $\rho > 0$, the LSI constant depends on $\rho$ via:
2000: 
2001: $$
2002: C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho) \le \frac{C_{\text{LSI}}^{\text{backbone}}}{1 - \epsilon_F \cdot C_{\text{adapt}}(\rho)}
2003: $$
2004: 
2005: where $C_{\text{adapt}}(\rho) = O(F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) / \kappa_x)$ quantifies the perturbation strength.
2006: 
2007: **Critical threshold:** Stability requires:
2008: 
2009: $$
2010: \epsilon_F < \epsilon_F^*(\rho) = \frac{1}{C_{\text{adapt}}(\rho)}

items.label: cor-n-uniform-lsi
items.title: N-Uniform Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality
items.content:
2137: :label: cor-n-uniform-lsi
2138: 
2139: Under the same conditions as Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-main-kl-convergence`, the LSI constant for the N-particle Euclidean Gas is **uniform in N**. That is, there exists a constant $C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} < \infty$ such that:
2140: 
2141: $$
2142: \sup_{N \geq 2} C_{\text{LSI}}(N) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max}
2143: $$
2144: 
2145: **Explicit bound**:
2146: 
2147: $$
2148: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_{W,\min} \cdot \delta^2}\right)
2149: $$
items.raw_directive:
